com.bignerdranch.android.multiselector

Class MultiSelector

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bignerdranch.android.multiselector.MultiSelector
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    SingleSelector

    public class MultiSelector
extends Object

    A class that handles selection logic and dispatches updates to connected instances of SelectableHolder.

    The out-of-the-box use of MultiSelector is to team it up with SwappingHolder for easy selection functionality in RecyclerViews. Like this:

     

 private MultiSelector mMultiSelector = new MultiSelector();

 public class MyViewHolder extends SwappingHolder
         implements View.OnClickListener {
     public MyViewHolder(View itemView) {
         super(itemView, mMultiSelector);
         itemView.setOnClickListener(this);
     }

     public void onClick(View view) {
         if (!mMultiSelector.tapSelection(this)) {
             // Item was clicked outside of selection mode
         }
     }
 }

        public MultiSelector()

    • Method Detail

      • isSelectable

        public boolean isSelectable()

        Current value of selectable.

        Returns:
        True if in selection mode.

      • setSelectable

        public void setSelectable(boolean isSelectable)

        Toggle whether this MultiSelector is in selection mode or not. SelectableHolder.setSelectable(boolean) will be called on any attached holders as well.

        Parameters:
        isSelectable - True if in selection mode.

      • setSelected

        public void setSelected(SelectableHolder holder,
                        boolean isSelected)

        Calls through to setSelected(int, long, boolean).

        Parameters:
        holder - Holder to set selection value for.
        isSelected - Whether the item should be selected.

      • setSelected

        public void setSelected(int position,
                        long id,
                        boolean isSelected)

        Sets whether a particular item is selected. In this implementation, id is ignored, but subclasses may use id instead.

        If a holder is bound for this position, this will call through to SelectableHolder.setActivated(boolean) for that holder.

        Parameters:
        position - Position to select/unselect.
        id - Item id to select/unselect. Ignored in this implementation.
        isSelected - Whether the item will be selected.

      • isSelected

        public boolean isSelected(int position,
                          long id)

        Returns whether a particular item is selected.

        Parameters:
        position - The position to test selection for.
        id - Item id to select/unselect. Ignored in this implementation.
        Returns:
        Whether the item is selected.

      • clearSelections

        public void clearSelections()

        Sets selected to false for all positions. Will refresh all bound holders.

      • getSelectedPositions

        public List<Integer> getSelectedPositions()

        Return a list of selected positions.

        Returns:
        A list of the currently selected positions.

      • bindHolder

        public void bindHolder(SelectableHolder holder,
                       int position,
                       long id)

        Bind a holder to a specific position/id. This implementation ignores the id.

        Bound holders will receive calls to SelectableHolder.setSelectable(boolean) and SelectableHolder.setActivated(boolean) when setSelectable(boolean) is called, or when setSelected(int, long, boolean) is called for the associated position, respectively.

        Parameters:
        holder - A holder to bind.
        position - Position the holder will be bound to.
        id - Item id the holder will be bound to. Ignored in this implementation.

      • tapSelection

        public boolean tapSelection(SelectableHolder holder)

        Calls through to tapSelection(int, long).

        Parameters:
        holder - The holder to tap.
        Returns:
        True if isSelectable() and selection was toggled for this item.

      • tapSelection

        public boolean tapSelection(int position,
                            long itemId)

        Convenience method to ease invoking selection logic. If isSelectable() is true, this method toggles selection for the specified item and returns true. Otherwise, it returns false and does nothing.

        Equivalent to:

         
 if (multiSelector.isSelectable()) {
     boolean isSelected = isSelected(position, itemId);
     setSelected(position, itemId, !isSelected);
     return true;
 } else {
     return false;
 }
        Parameters:
        position - Position to tap.
        itemId - Item id to tap. Ignored in this implementation.
        Returns:
        True if the item was toggled.

      • refreshAllHolders

        public void refreshAllHolders()

      • saveSelectionStates

        public Bundle saveSelectionStates()
        Returns:
        Bundle containing the states of the selection and a flag indicating if the multiselection is in selection mode or not

      • restoreSelectionStates

        public void restoreSelectionStates(Bundle savedStates)
        restore the selection states of the multiselector and the ViewHolder Trackers
        Parameters:
        savedStates - Saved state bundle, probably from a fragment or activity.
